intro: Scabiosa virescens, commonly known as the green scabious, is a perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces clusters of small, fluffy, pink or white flowers that bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its flowers are composed of numerous tiny petals arranged in a spherical shape, giving it a distinctive appearance. Scabiosa virescens is often found in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
